PIONEER DIET: WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN PIONEERS EAT?

Instructions: Please answer as many of these questions as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask., where it will be preserved as part of the permanent record of our Province.

Name: Mrs. Alice Peel
Address: Terlinden, Sask.
Birthplace: Teeswater, Ont.

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1910.
Where did you set up housekeeping? South end of Terlinden.
Where had you been living before that? Craigton, Sask., Ontario.
For how many people did you prepare meals? 6.
How far was it to your nearest store? 3-4 miles.
How often could a visit be made to the store? Once or twice a month.
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? Sugar, flour, salt, coffee, tea, sugar, lard, fruit, and an old can of blueberries (if they were cheap) also corn syrup.

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Red Star.
In what quantities did you buy it? One or two sacks could last a year.
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? Nearly $5.00.
How much did you use graham flour? None.
Whole wheat flour? None.
Was flour milled locally? Yes, how far away? 1 mile, what year? 1910.
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats?
What other grain products did you use? Cornmeal, Whole Wheat, Farina.
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Yes.
How did you grind it? With a hand mill, it took about five minutes to make a little flour into it.

Name: Mrs. Alice Peel

Address: 7600 12th Avenue, Saskatoon, Saskatchewan

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1910

Where did you set up housekeeping? 810 12th Avenue

Where had you been living before that? 810 12th Avenue

For how many people did you prepare meals? 5

How far was it to your nearest store? 1 mile

How often could a visit be made to the store? Weekly

What groceries did you normally buy in those early years? Flour, sugar, tea, coffee, salt, butter, eggs, milk, vegetables, fruit, meat, fish, bread, cheese, jam, jelly, preserves, canned goods, etc.

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Red Star

In what quantities did you buy it? 50 lbs per month

What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? 75¢ per lb

How much did you use graham flour? 10 lbs per month

Whole wheat flour? 10 lbs per month

Was flour milled locally? Yes

How far away? 10 miles

What year? 1910

What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? 35¢

What other grain products did you use? Oats, buckwheat, barley, rye, cornmeal, rice, etc.

Other? None

Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Yes

How did you grind it? With a hand mill

Other? None

At what price?

How did you preserve meat? Corned beef, salted
